intro: Cynanchum isidrense, commonly known as the Isidrense milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically yellowish-green with prominent, spurred petals, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Cynanchum isidrense is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed areas.
